body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"orderedList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{iπ}+1=0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{iπ}=-1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{-iπ}=-1^{-1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{-iπ}=-1=e^{iπ}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-iπ=iπ."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-i=i."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1=-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".[dividing by -i]"}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In which line did I make mistake?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The Euler equation  (step 1 above)  is proven with calculus by substituting Pi for x into the equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"cos(x) + i.sin(x) = e^(i.x)  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which is true for all real x."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Unfortunately, substituting -Pi gives e^(-i. Pi)=-1    which is step 4."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"With no implication that i.Pi  =  - i.Pi "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Once we have our dear friend Cos involved, we realise lots of different reals have the same cosine."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 115500 needs positive divisor
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The total number of proper positive divisors of 115500 is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: The term \"proper divisors\" excludes the number itself."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number given is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"115500 = 100\times 11 \times 105 = 2^2.3.5^3.7. 11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus the number of factors is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3\times 2\times 4\times 2\times 2 = 96"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and this includes the number itself. But in PROPER divisors, we have to exclude the number itself, hence the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{95}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Precious: Notice that the factor 2 can be included 0, 1 or 2 times, which is 3 possibilities. Likewise, the factor 3 can be included 0 or 1 times, which is 2 possibilities. 5 can be included from 0 to 3 times, which is 4 possibilities. And so on.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Response"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" Astro"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Enthusiast"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" : Actually there is a formula that for every positive composite number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and its distinct prime factors "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c,d........."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" p,q,r,s............."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"being the indices of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c,d........"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=a^{p} \times b^{q} \times c^{r} \times d^{s} \times ............"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then total factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=(p+1)(q+1)(r+1)(s+1)..................."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Proper divisors only excludes the number itself, but include 1. So the answer should be 96-1=95."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I've updated the answer to 95.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I_2 = \dfrac{V_T}{R_2}\\ \\

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\frac{5}{x} + \\frac{7}{y} = \\frac{5}{7} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" x > 0 ; y > 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Suppose the number of integer solution is A with the set of integer pairs  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (x_i,y_i) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" being "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (x_1,y_1),(x_2,y_2),....(x_A,y_A) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\sum_{i=1}^{A} x_i + \\sum_{i=1}^{A} y_i "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find other problems of this "},{"type":"text","text":"set","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \frac{5}{x} + \frac{7}{y} & = \frac{5}{7} \\ \Rightarrow 35x + 49y & = 5xy \\ \Rightarrow 5xy - 35x - 49y + 343 & = 343 \\ \Rightarrow (x - 7)(5y - 49) & = 343 \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"343"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be written as a product of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" integers in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ways:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\pm{1}, \pm{343}), (\pm{343}, \pm{1}), (\pm{7}, \pm{49}), (\pm{49}, \pm{7})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"orderedList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = 1, 5y - 49 = 343 \Rightarrow x = 8, y = \frac{392}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = 343, 5y - 49 = 1 \Rightarrow x = 350, y = 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = 7, 5y - 49 = 49 \Rightarrow x = 14, y = \frac{98}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = 49, 5y - 49 = 7 \Rightarrow x = 56, y = \frac{56}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = -1, 5y - 49 = -343 \Rightarrow x = 6, y = \frac{-294}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = -343, 5y - 49 = -1 \Rightarrow x = -336, y = \frac{48}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = -7, 5y - 49 = -49 \Rightarrow x = 0, y = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x - 7 = -49, 5y - 49 = -7 \Rightarrow x = -42, y = \frac{42}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Of the above 8 cases only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 350, y = 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfy "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x > 0, y > 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sum_{i=1}^{A} x_i + \sum_{i=1}^{A} y_i  = 350 + 10 = \boxed{360}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"  { I }_{ 3 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or (current of  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" { R }_{ 3 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") of the circuit."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Voltage in a parallel circuit is constant and the current across each resistance is given by"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{V_T}{R}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I_3 = \dfrac{V_T}{R_3}\\ \\
= \dfrac{600}{150}\\ \\

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the answer to this question, then what is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n^2 - 117,992"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n^2-117992=n
n^2-117992-n=0
(n+343)(n-344)=0
n=-343 or n=344"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"since n is a positive integer, we would rule out -343, thus answer is 344"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I solved it with trial and error using a calculator... but I'm sure there's a more systematic approach..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However as we now know (if you didn't already) the answer is "},{"type":"text","text":"344","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":".  Shortly after I found this:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"344 x 343 = 117, 992","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"They're also consecutive numbers..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Maybe someone could build on that...?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 117th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/IyALVwktBR-parallel-circuit.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the above circuit, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" { R }_{ 1 }=100 \ \Omega"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ R }_{ 2 }=300 \ \Omega"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ R }_{ 3 }=600 \ \Omega"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ V }_{ T }=150 \ V "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", what is the total current "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I_T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the circuit?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Part One."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is part five of a problem."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The total resistance is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{\left(\dfrac{1}{100} + \dfrac{1}{300} + \dfrac{1}{600}\right)}^{-1} = \dfrac{200}{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Now, using Ohm's Law:- "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I = \dfrac{V}{R} = \dfrac{150 × 3}{200} = \color{#3D99F6}{\boxed{2.25 A}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equivalent resistance of the circuit "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" R_{eq} = \dfrac 1{\frac 1{R_1} + \frac 1{R_2} + \frac 1{R_3}} = \dfrac 1{\frac 1{100} + \frac 1{300} + \frac 1{600}} = \dfrac {200}3 \ \Omega "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, the total current "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I_T = \dfrac {R_{eq}}{V_T} = 150 \times \dfrac 3{200} = \boxed{2.25} \ A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Refer this "},{"type":"text","text":"solution","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" first."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, total resistance is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{200}{3} \Omega"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"V = IR \\ \implies I = \frac{V}{R} = \dfrac{150}{\frac{200}{3}} = 2.25"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{n=1}^\infty \binom{4n}{2n}^{-1}=X+\frac{\pi}{\sqrt{Y}}-\frac{2}{Z\sqrt{Z}}\ln\left(\frac{1+\sqrt{Z}}{2}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equation above holds true for rational numbers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{XYZ}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\binom{\cdot}{\cdot}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the "},{"type":"text","text":"binomial coefficient","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":".  The first few terms of the series are as follows:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}
\sum_{n=1}^\infty \binom{4n}{2n}^{-1} &= \frac{1}{\binom{4}{2}} + \frac{1}{\binom{8}{4}} + \frac{1}{\binom{12}{6}} + \cdots \\
&= \frac{1}{6}+\frac{1}{70}+\frac{1}{924}+\cdots.
\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Hardest Brilliant problem I've seen.   You can't even be bothered to give the solution.  No, I didn't get it, but I did verify the approximate solution."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The cited page gives X=16/15"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"pi/sqrt(Y)=pi*sqrt(3)/27 from which Y=243"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2/(Z"},{"type":"text","text":"sqrt(Z))=2","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"sqrt(5)/25 from which Z=5"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"XYZ=1296"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"sqrt(1296)=36

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            There are two approaches that can lead to the exact solution.  But for me, both of them requires programs like Wolfram Alpha or Mathetica to finish the last step."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method 1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{{2n \choose n}^{-1}} = \int_0^1(2n+1)y^n(1-y)^ndy"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"With this identity, the answer will be:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\int_0^1\frac{1 + 3z}{(1 - z)^2}dy - 1, z = (y(1-y))^2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method 2,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) = \sum_{n=0}^\infty {2n \choose n }^{-1}x^n "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then what we want is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{f(1) + f(-1)}{2} - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) = _2F_1(1, 1; \frac{1}{2}; \frac{x}{4}) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"_2F_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the hypergeometric function.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}
